summary:
11. Calls on parties to comply with international law, including humanitarian and human rights law.

12. Calls for international community support to help Yemen meet political, security, economic, and humanitarian challenges.

13. Encourages humanitarian assistance and full funding of the 2012 Humanitarian Response Plan.

14. Emphasizes the importance of the Government of National Unity's two-year development plan and donor support.

15. Expresses concern over Al-Qaida attacks and determination to address the threat.

16. Requests the Secretary-General to continue good offices, including through his Special Adviser, and welcomes UN political engagement in Yemen.

17. Requests the Secretary-General to coordinate international assistance for the National Dialogue and transition.

18. Requests the Secretary-General to report on developments in Yemen every 60 days.

19. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
